articles.description: "Every year is a little bit different."
articles.content:
The rate at which sea levels rise is increasing, researchers say, and last year the levels climbed more than 30% over what was expected.
What's happening?

articles.title: The European Space Agency will beam the famous 'Blue Danube' waltz into space - NPR
articles.description: A performance of the masterpiece will be transmitted into space on Saturday. The waltz has been associated with space travel since its inclusion in the film 2001: A Space Odyssey.
articles.content:
Johann Strauss II's popular orchestral piece "By the Beautiful Blue Danube" has been inextricably linked to space since it was used in the 1968 classic film2001: A Space Odyssey.
The waltz played as… [+2494 chars]

articles.author: Jorge Garay
articles.title: The Milky Way Has a Mysterious ‘Broken Bone’ - WIRED
articles.description: Galactic bones, filaments of radio-wave-emitting particles, run through our galaxy, and one of them has a fracture. New analysis suggests collision with a neutron star may have caused it.
articles.content: If you look at the Milky Way through a powerful telescope, youll notice that close to the center of the galaxy there are elongated filaments that seem to outline its spiral shape. Scientists have a n… [+2493 chars]
